title: “Act of 2010” means the Financial Emergency Measures in the Public Interest
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 

2017 (Section 27(3)) Order 2020. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 order may cited public service pay pension act 2017 (section 27(3)) order 2020 interpretation

title: “Act of 2010” means the Financial Emergency Measures in the Public Interest
heading: 2. (1) In this Order -
text_raw:
2. (1) In this Order - 

“Act of 2010” means the Financial Emergency Measures in the Public Interest 
Act 2010 (No. 38 of 2010); 

“Act of 2013” means the Financial Emergency Measures in the Public Interest 
Act 2013 (No. 18 of 2013); 

“Act of 2017” means the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 2017 (No. 34 of 
2017). 

(2) In this Order a word or expression that is used in this Order and is 
also used in the Act of 2010 shall have the meaning in this Order that it has in 
the Act of 2010. 

Cases to which this Order applies
text_norm: 2 (1) order - act 2010 mean financial emergency measure public interest act 2010 (no 38 2010) act 2013 mean financial emergency measure public interest act 2013 (no 18 2013) act 2017 mean public service pay pension act 2017 (no 34 2017) (2) order word expression used order also used act 2010 shall meaning order act 2010 case order applies

title: “Act of 2010” means the Financial Emergency Measures in the Public Interest
heading: 3. This Order shall apply to any case in which the operation of sections 25
text_raw:
3. This Order shall apply to any case in which the operation of sections 25 
and 26 of the Act of 2017 has not had the effect, by 31 December 2020, that 
the annualised amount of the public service pension of a person, payable in 
accordance with his or her entitlement, stands - 

(a) 

subject to paragraph (b), at the amount at which it would have 
stood, on the date of its award, if the Act of 2010 had not been 
enacted, or 

(b) where the person is a person to whom section 2A of the Act of 
2010 applies, at the amount at which it would have stood, on the 
date of its award, if the Act of 2013 had not been enacted, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 25th December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [632] 3 

and the reference in Article 4 to the relevant original amount is a reference to 
the amount referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), as the case may be. 

Full restoration of public service pension

title: “Act of 2010” means the Financial Emergency Measures in the Public Interest
heading: In any case to which this Order applies, on and from 1 July 2021, the
text_raw:
4. 

In any case to which this Order applies, on and from 1 July 2021, the 
annualised amount of the public service pension of the person referred to in 
Article 3, payable in accordance with his or her entitlement, shall not be less 
than the relevant original amount. 

Construction of certain reference
text_norm: 4 case order applies 1 july 2021 annualised amount public service pension person referred article 3 payable accordance entitlement shall le relevant original amount construction certain reference

title: “Act of 2010” means the Financial Emergency Measures in the Public Interest
heading: 5. (1) Subsection (4) of section 27 of the Act of 2017 shall apply to the
text_raw:
5. (1) Subsection (4) of section 27 of the Act of 2017 shall apply to the 
construction of the reference in Article 3(a) to the amount at which the public 
service pension of a person, payable in accordance with his or her entitlement, 
would have stood, on the date of its award, if the Act of 2010 had not been 
enacted as that subsection applies to the construction of the like reference set 
out in that subsection. 

(2) Article 2(2) and paragraph (1) are without prejudice to the 
application of section 19 of the Interpretation Act 2005 (No. 23 of 2005) to this 
Order. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

15 December, 2020. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform.
